summary: App to support workaholism recovery and medication adherence, with additional user-requested focus on avoiding legal/institutional crises and promoting lawful/values-aligned decision-making.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and gate all personal data behind the signed-in user (principal), so each user can only read/write their own recovery and medication data.

Create a structured “Workaholism Recovery Program” module that lets the user work through a full program in an organized way: a list of steps/modules, each with a description, reflections/journaling prompts, and a completion checklist.
Add daily recovery check-ins to support “mastery” of the program: mood/stress slider(s), work-hours logged for the day, a brief reflection, and a configurable daily intention related to recovery.
Add a “Meetings & Sponsor Support” tracker (generic, not tied to any external service): record meetings attended (date, format, notes), sponsor contact notes, and optional goals for the next meeting.

Implement a medication plan manager that the user can configure to match their psychiatric treatment plan: medication name, dose, schedule (times per day), start/end dates (optional), instructions, and prescriber/clinic notes.
Add medication adherence logging: for each scheduled dose, allow the user to mark Taken/Skipped/Late and optionally record a note (e.g., side effect, reason).

Provide reminder support for medication and daily check-ins using in-app reminders and a clear “Today” dashboard (do not rely on push notifications): show upcoming doses, overdue doses, and an end-of-day check-in prompt.

Add safety and scope disclaimers in the UI: the app does not provide medical advice, does not replace therapy/psychiatry, and is not for emergencies; include a dedicated “Crisis/Help” page with user-editable emergency contacts and local guidance placeholders.
Support export of the user’s recovery progress and medication adherence logs to a downloadable JSON and a human-readable summary (plain text), suitable for sharing with a clinician or sponsor.

Create a coherent, calming visual theme and information architecture for the app (typography, color palette, spacing, and component styling) that supports recovery-focused daily use and stays consistent across all pages.
Add onboarding to set up the user’s baseline: recovery goals, typical work hours, preferred check-in time, and initial medication plan entry (optional).
Add two generated static images and render them in the UI as local assets under frontend/public/assets/generated: an app logo and a soft hero illustration.

Add explicit UI disclaimers stating the app does not provide legal advice, does not provide religious/spiritual rulings, and cannot guarantee perfect compliance with any laws or religious rules; ensure all user-facing disclaimer text is in English and is shown alongside existing safety disclaimers.

Create a new signed-in page for “Staying Safe & Out of Trouble” (lawful + values-aligned decision support) that provides practical, non-judgmental self-management content (e.g., grounding steps, a pause-and-plan checklist, and links to Crisis/Help) without claiming prevention or compliance guarantees.

Allow the user to save and edit a personal “commitments & boundaries” plan used by the “Staying Safe & Out of Trouble” page (e.g., personal commitments, things to avoid, and ‘when I’m at risk, I will…’ steps) and persist it per-user in the Motoko backend.

new_feature_requests.summary: Workaholism recovery program companion to help user fully work through and master the Workaholics Anonymous program
Medication adherence support (reminders/tracking) aligned with the user’s psychiatric treatment plan

Persist all app data in the Motoko backend with stable data models and query/update methods for: program progress, step reflections, check-ins, meetings/sponsor notes, medication plans, dose logs, emergency contacts, and user settings.

Add a “staying safe & out of trouble” support area focused on lawful, non-harmful choices and avoiding institutionalization/jail (e.g., practical checklists, grounding steps, crisis plan reminders), without claiming perfect compliance guarantees

projectName: Workaholism recovery program companion + medication adherence tracker
